de.polygonal.ds.pooling.LinkedObjectPool

type
class
A growable object pool based on a doubly linked list.
See http://lab.polygonal.de/2008/06/18/using-object-pools/.

Constructor

new(x : Int, ?growable : Bool)
Creates an object pool capable of managing x pre-allocated objects.
Use allocate() to fill the pool. If growable is true, new objects are allocated the first time an object is requested while the pool being dried out.

Instance Methods

allocate(?C : Class<T>, ?fabricate : Void -> T, ?factory : Factory<T>) : Void

parameters
C Allocates objects by creating instances of C.
fabricate Allocates objects by calling fabricate().
factory Allocates objects by calling factory.create().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid arguments.
Allocates the pool with x objects. Objects can be allocated by providing a class, a 'factory method' or a 'class factory'.

free() : Void

Nullifies references so all used resources can be garbage collected.

get() : T

throws
String Object pool exhausted.
Retrieves the next available object from the pool.

getSize() : Int

The total number of pre-allocated objects in the pool.

getUsageCount() : Int

The number of used objects.

getWasteCount() : Int

The total number of unused thus wasted objects. Use the purge() to compact the pool.

purge() : Void

Removes all unused objects from the pool. If the number of remaining used objects is smaller than the initial capacity defined in the constructor, new objects are created to refill the pool.

put(o : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Object pool is full (if debug flag is set).
Recycles the given object so it can be used in another context.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
